You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. It's great that you're taking the time to research and find a tour that fits your interests and budget. Remember to also consider the type of travel style you're comfortable with, the level of physical activity you're willing to do, and the type of accommodations you prefer.

Intrepid Travel and G Adventures are both well-established companies with a wide range of tours, so I'm sure you'll find something that suits you. And don't hesitate to reach out to the local tour operators I mentioned if you have any questions or want more information.

Additionally, consider the following tips when choosing a tour:

* Read reviews from multiple sources, including travel forums and review websites.
* Ask about the tour operator's sustainability and responsible travel practices.
* Check if the tour operator is a member of any industry associations, such as the Japanese Association of Travel Agents (JATA).
* Look for tours that offer flexibility and free time, in case you want to explore on your own.
* Consider the size of the group and the guide-to-traveler ratio.

By doing your research and asking the right questions, you'll be able to find a tour that fits your needs and provides an unforgettable experience in Japan.

If you have any more questions or need further recommendations, feel free to ask. Good luck with your tour search, and I hope you have an amazing time in Japan!
